sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: (UTZ) Volatility Zones as Tactical Triggers

It highlights an exceptional 42.7:1 risk-reward setup targeting a 13.1% gain versus a 0.3% risk. The AI models propose three distinct trading strategies—Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—tailored to different risk profiles.

It details an exceptional 44.0:1 risk-reward setup targeting a 13.4% gain versus 0.3% risk, along with AI-generated trading strategies for different risk profiles. The analysis includes position trading, momentum breakout, and risk hedging strategies, alongside multi-timeframe signal analysis.

feed.title: Utz Brands raises annual dividend by 3.3% to $0.252 per share
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. (NYSE:UTZ) has announced a 3.3% increase in its annual dividend to $0.252 per share, marking its fifth consecutive year of dividend increases. The snack manufacturer will pay a quarterly cash dividend of approximately $0.063 per share on January 2, 2026, to stockholders of record as of December 15, 2025. This announcement follows better-than-expected third-quarter revenue and plans to expand into California, though one analyst firm revised its price target due to concerns over future EBITDA and margin growth.

feed.title: Utz Brands (NYSE: UTZ) raises annual dividend to $0.252, sets $0.063 quarterly payout
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced an increase in its annual dividend from $0.244 to $0.252 per share, effective immediately. This translates to a quarterly cash dividend of approximately $0.063 per share on Class A Common Stock. Payment is scheduled for January 2, 2026, to stockholders of record as of December 15, 2025.

feed.title: Utz Brands raises annual dividend by 3.3% to $0.252 per share
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced a 3.3% increase in its annual dividend to $0.252 per share, marking its fifth consecutive year of increases. The snack manufacturer declared a quarterly cash dividend of approximately $0.063 per share, payable on January 2, 2026, to stockholders of record as of December 15, 2025. This decision follows better-than-expected third-quarter revenue and plans for market expansion in California.

feed.title: Utz Brands raises annual dividend by 3.3% to $0.252 per share
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. (NYSE:UTZ) has announced a 3.3% increase in its annual dividend, raising it from $0.244 to $0.252 per share. This marks the fifth consecutive year of dividend increases for the snack manufacturer. The company will pay a quarterly cash dividend of approximately $0.063 per share on January 2, 2026, to stockholders of record as of December 15, 2025.

feed.title: Utz (NYSE: UTZ) to webcast Stephens Annual Investment Conference at 11 a.m. ET Nov 18
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. (NYSE: UTZ) announced it will webcast its presentation at the Stephens Annual Investment Conference on November 18, 2025, at 11:00 a.m. ET. The live webcast will be available on the company's investor relations website, with a replay archived for 90 days. Utz also details its diverse snack portfolio and communication channels for investors.

feed.summary: This article analyzes Utz Brands Inc (NYSE: UTZ) trends within macro strategies, indicating weak sentiment across all horizons which supports a short bias. It details institutional trading strategies including long, breakout, and short positions, along with multi-timeframe signal analysis, and provides AI-generated signals for support and resistance levels.

feed.title: Utz Brands, Inc. (NYSE:UTZ) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: This article provides the Q3 2025 earnings call transcript for Utz Brands, Inc. (NYSE:UTZ). It delivers direct insights into the company's financial performance and strategic outlook as discussed by its management during the call.

feed.title: Utz Brands Executives and Directors Increase Their Stakes
feed.summary: Multiple executives and directors at Utz Brands (NYSE:UTZ) have increased their stakes in the company through recent stock purchases. EVP and General Counsel Shea Theresa Robbins, CEO Howard A. Friedman, and Directors Lissette Dylan and Timothy Brown all acquired additional shares of Class A Common Stock. These transactions reflect increased direct ownership by key insiders in the company.

feed.title: Utz Appoints William J. Kelley Jr. as Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced the appointment of William J. Kelley Jr. as Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Principal Accounting Officer, effective May 1, 2025, succeeding Ajay Kataria. The company also announced the retirement of Mark Schreiber, Chief Customer Officer, who will be succeeded by Jeremy Stuart. Additionally, Utz reaffirmed its fiscal year 2025 outlook and provided preliminary first-quarter 2025 results, expecting net sales to increase between 1.5% and 1.7% and adjusted EBITDA between $44 million and $46 million.

feed.title: Utz Brands launches new snacks - Central Penn Business Journal
feed.summary: Utz Brands is launching a new range of snack flavors and product innovations at the 2025 National Association of Convenience Stores Show in Chicago. The new products include seasonal and globally inspired flavors for their Utz Cheese Balls, Utz Ripples, Utz Kettle Chips, Boulder Canyon, Zapp’s, Golden Flake, and TGI Fridays snack lines, aiming to meet evolving consumer demands in the convenience channel. Stacey Schultz, Senior Vice President of Marketing, highlights the company's continuous evolution to address consumer trends.

feed.title: Utz Brands, Inc. to Showcase Variety of Innovative Products at 2025 NACS Show - Bluefield Daily Telegraph
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. is set to feature its latest snack innovations at the 2025 NACS Show in Chicago, IL, from October 15–17. The company will introduce new flavors for its Utz Cheese Balls, Utz Ripples, Utz Kettle Chips, Zapp’s, Golden Flake, and TGIF brands, alongside emphasizing its commitment to simple, quality ingredients with new front-of-pack claims for its flagship potato chip products. Stacy Schultze, SVP, Marketing at Utz Quality Foods, LLC, highlighted the company's continuous evolution of its portfolio to meet consumer trends and changing needs within the convenience channel.

feed.title: Utz Brands, Inc. to Showcase Variety of Innovative Products at 2025 NACS Show - The Joplin Globe
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. is set to showcase a variety of innovative snack products at the 2025 NACS Show in Chicago, IL, from October 15–17. The new offerings include multiple bold flavors for existing brands like Utz Cheese Balls and Utz Ripples, as well as new kettle chip flavors for Utz, Zapp's, Boulder Canyon, Golden Flake, and TGI Fridays. Utz also plans to highlight its commitment to simple, quality ingredients with new front-of-pack claims on its flagship potato chip products.

feed.title: Utz Brands declares quarterly dividend of $0.061 per share
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. (NYSE:UTZ) has declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of approximately $0.061 per share, payable on October 2, 2025, to stockholders of record as of September 15, 2025. The company has consistently raised its dividend for five consecutive years and maintains a current yield of 1.99%. This announcement follows a recent earnings report where Utz Brands' EPS fell short of analyst expectations, though revenue slightly exceeded forecasts.

feed.title: Utz Launches Lemonade Potato Chips
feed.summary: Utz Brands Inc. has launched limited-edition, lemonade-flavored potato chips in partnership with Alex’s Lemonade Stand Foundation to support childhood cancer research. These chips, available through August, combine tangy sweetness with salty crunch, with a portion of sales up to $25,000 going to the charity.

feed.title: Utz Brands Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. reported its financial results for the fiscal fourth quarter and full year ended December 29, 2024. The company achieved strong Branded Salty Snacks Organic Net Sales growth, expanded gross profit margins, and increased Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted Net Income for both periods, while providing a positive outlook for fiscal year 2025, including low-single digit Organic Net Sales Growth and double-digit Adjusted EPS Growth.

feed.title: Utz Brands Announces Continued Acceleration of Supply Chain Transformation Strategy and Completes Term Loan Repricing
feed.summary: Utz Brands announced the sale of two manufacturing facilities to Our Home for $18.5 million, with net cash proceeds of $14 million to be used for debt reduction and cash on the balance sheet. This move accelerates its supply chain transformation strategy, reducing its manufacturing facilities from 16 to 8 since 2021. Additionally, Utz completed a repricing of its $630 million Term Loan, which is expected to save approximately $2 million in annual cash interest expenses.

feed.title: Utz officially opens new York County distribution center
feed.summary: Utz Brands has officially opened its new 650,000 square-foot 'Rice Distribution Center' in Hanover, York County, named in honor of Michael W. Rice. This state-of-the-art facility will serve as the primary logistics hub for inventory storage, consolidation, and distribution for Utz facilities across the United States, significantly expanding capacity and enhancing efficiency. The opening marks a major step in the company's growth, following previous announcements of plant closures and sales.

feed.title: Utz announces opening of new warehouse in York Co.
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced the upcoming grand opening of its new 650,000 square foot warehouse facility in Hanover, York County, scheduled for Thursday, December 5. This new Northeast Logistics Center is a major step in optimizing their network and supporting future growth, following the closure of their oldest plant in Hanover in September 2023. Additionally, Utz recently sold its Lititz, Lancaster County manufacturing facility as part of a $185 million deal.

feed.title: Utz Brands weathering competitive storm
feed.summary: Utz Brands Inc. reported market share gains and adjusted earnings per share above Wall Street expectations for its fiscal 2024 third quarter, despite increased competition. The company increased marketing investment and focused on value to drive volume growth, particularly in its Power Brands and non-measured channels. While facing a more promotional environment and some share losses in potato chips, Utz reaffirmed its full-year guidance for adjusted EPS and organic net sales growth.

feed.title: Utz Brands expands snack portfolio through strategic acquisitions
feed.summary: Utz Brands is expanding its snack portfolio and streamlining its supply chain through strategic acquisitions and divestitures. The company is acquiring Festida Foods to enhance its tortilla chip production and improve operational efficiencies, while also divesting its Good Health and R.W. Garcia brands to focus on core offerings. These moves are part of Utz's long-term vision to optimize its supply chain, enhance brand portfolio, and improve financial performance.

feed.title: Utz Brands Announces Acceleration of Supply Chain Transformation and Brand Portfolio Strategy
feed.summary: Utz Brands announced the sale of its Good Health® and R.W. Garcia® brands and three manufacturing facilities to Our Home™ for $182.5 million. The move is expected to accelerate its supply chain transformation, optimize its brand portfolio for growth, and reduce long-term debt by a full year. The Company also provided preliminary fiscal-year 2023 net sales results, estimating growth of 2.0% to 2.2%, and narrowed its Adjusted EBITDA outlook to 9.5% to 10.0% growth.

feed.title: Utz Brands Appoints Howard Friedman As CEO
feed.summary: Utz Brands announced Howard Friedman will become its new CEO, effective December 15, 2022, succeeding Dylan Lissette, who will transition to Executive Chairman of the Board. This leadership change was part of a succession plan initiated during the company's merger and follows Lissette's significant contributions, including nearly tripling sales to over $1.3 billion and overseeing six acquisitions since going public in 2020. Utz Brands also reaffirmed its fiscal year 2022 outlook, expecting total net sales growth of 13-15% and Adjusted EBITDA growth of 2-5%.

feed.title: Utz expands into Publix markets
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. reported a net income of $2.5 million in the second quarter, attributing results to higher pricing and market share gains in salty snacks. The company announced a significant expansion into nearly 1,300 Publix stores and plans to ramp up production at its Kings Mountain facility to meet demand for brands like Zapp’s kettle chips. Utz achieved double-digit retail sales growth across all geographies and categories representing 80% of its sales.

feed.title: Utz Brands to Add New Manufacturing Facility in Kings Mountain, North Carolina
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced the purchase of a snack food manufacturing facility in Kings Mountain, North Carolina, from Evans Food Group Ltd. d/b/a Benestar Brands. This acquisition will expand Utz's production capacity, support increased demand in key regions, and is expected to create over 115 local jobs. The transaction of approximately USD 38.4 million is anticipated to be accretive to earnings within 12-18 months due to supply chain cost savings.

feed.title: Utz Brands to Add Manufacturing Facility in Kings Mountain, NC
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced the purchase of a new snack food manufacturing facility in Kings Mountain, North Carolina, from Evans Food Group Ltd. d/b/a Benestar Brands. This acquisition, totaling approximately $38.4 million, aims to support the growing demand for Utz's brands, optimize their supply chain, and is expected to create over 115 new local jobs. The transaction is projected to be accretive to earnings within 12-18 months due to anticipated cost savings and increased operational flexibility.

feed.title: Utz Celebrates With 100 Years for Utz, $100,000 for You Sweepstakes!
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. is celebrating its first 100 years by launching the "100 Years for Utz, $100,000 for You Sweepstakes," offering one lucky fan a chance to win $100,000. Consumers can enter online or by text, and also join the Utz Centennial Club for exclusive benefits. The company reflects on its century-long legacy of crafting quality snack foods and looks forward to continuing its tradition of "Family-Crafted-Flavor."

feed.title: Utz Brands acquires North Carolina manufacturing plant
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. has acquired a 125,000-square-foot snack food manufacturing plant in Kings Mountain, NC, from Evans Food Group Ltd. (Benestar Brands) for $38.4 million. The company plans to convert the facility into a fully operational snack food plant, creating over 115 new jobs and improving operational flexibility and long-term margins. Benestar Brands will continue to supply pork pellets to Utz from its Chicago-based operations as part of this strategic partnership.

feed.title: Utz enhancing distribution network with acquisitions
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. is expanding its direct-store delivery (DSD) network in the New York City region by acquiring Clem Snacks, Inc. and J&D Snacks, Inc. These acquisitions include 125 DSD routes, which are expected to accelerate Utz's market share growth in the salty snack category. This move aims to expand the distribution of Utz's brands through an existing independent operator network in a key market.

feed.title: Limited-edition chip flavors introduced by Utz
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. has launched two new limited-edition chip varieties for the summer season. These include a collaboration with Grillo's Pickles for a classic dill pickle flavor and Utz Ripple potato chips coated with cheddar cheese ball flavor. Both new offerings are available for a limited time on the company's website.

feed.title: Utz Brands Celebrates 100-Year Anniversary With U.S. House of Representative Member Lloyd Smucker; Dylan Lissette Details
feed.summary: Utz Brands celebrated its 100-year anniversary with U.S. House of Representative member Lloyd Smucker (PA-11) visiting their headquarters to present a congressional record proclamation. CEO Dylan Lissette highlighted the company's commitment to its legacy of crafting world-class snacks. Congressman Smucker recognized Utz's significant impact on the community and the snack food industry through both business and charitable efforts.

feed.title: Utz Brands Is Recognized for Its 100 Year Anniversary by U.S. House of Representative Member Lloyd Smucker
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. was recognized by U.S. House of Representative member Lloyd Smucker for its 100-year anniversary. Congressman Smucker personally visited Utz's headquarters to present a congressional record, honoring the company's achievements in the snack food industry and charitable efforts. CEO Dylan Lissette expressed honor for the recognition and highlighted the company's commitment to quality snacks and continued growth.

feed.title: Utz promotes three in executive shuffle
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced an executive management reshuffle, appointing a new chief operating officer, chief financial officer, and chief people officer to optimize the company for its next growth phase. Cary Devore transitions to executive vice president and COO, Ajay Kataria becomes executive vice president and CFO, and Jim Sponaugle is named executive vice president and chief people officer. These changes, following recent appointments of a chief growth officer and chief customer officer, aim to enhance Utz's leadership and strategic execution.

feed.title: Utz Brands Appoints New CFO, COO, CPO
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced several executive management team changes to accelerate growth capabilities. Cary Devore was appointed EVP and COO, Ajay Kataria became EVP and CFO, and Jim Sponaugle was named EVP and Chief People Officer, all effective October 4, 2021. Additionally, Todd Staub, EVP and Chief Administrative Officer, shared his intention to retire effective January 3, 2022.

feed.title: Two executives promoted at Utz
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. has promoted Shane Chambers to the newly created role of executive vice president and chief growth officer, and Mark Schreiber to executive vice president of sales and chief customer officer. Mr. Chambers will oversee marketing, branding, strategic growth, and M&A, while Mr. Schreiber will manage all sales aspects, trade marketing, revenue management, and category and shopper insights. These promotions aim to accelerate Utz's growth and evolution as a public company.

feed.title: Utz broadening distribution reach in Florida
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. has acquired distribution rights in Central Florida from National Food Corp., consisting of 21 direct-store delivery (DSD) routes. This strategic acquisition is set to significantly accelerate Utz's market share in the salty snack category across key Central Florida cities and capitalize on geographic expansion opportunities. The move follows strong sales growth in Florida for Utz, which aims to introduce new buyers and innovation to the region.

feed.title: Utz Brands to Acquire Vitner’s Snacks
feed.summary: Utz Brands Inc. has agreed to acquire the Vitner's snack brand from Snak-King Corp. for $25 million, including intellectual property and direct-store-delivery assets. This acquisition is expected to boost Utz's presence significantly in the Chicago and Midwest markets, moving it from the No. 7 to No. 4 position among salty snacks in Chicago. The deal is projected to close on February 8, 2021, and is part of Utz’s strategy to expand in major metropolitan areas and drive long-term value for shareholders.

feed.title: Utz ramps up competitor advantage in Midwest with acquisition of iconic Chicago snack brand
feed.summary: Utz Quality Foods has acquired Vitner’s from Snak King for $25 million, strengthening its presence in the US Midwest, particularly Chicago's salty snack market. This acquisition leverages Vitner's direct-store delivery routes and is part of Utz's ongoing strategy to expand in major metropolitan areas, following previous significant acquisitions. The deal is expected to be accretive to earnings in 2021 and beyond.

feed.title: Utz Brands to acquire Vitner’s snack brand
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. is set to acquire certain assets of the Vitner’s snack brand from Snak-King Corp. for $25 million, a move expected to strengthen Utz’s presence in the Chicago and Midwest markets. The transaction, which includes intellectual property and direct-store delivery assets, is anticipated to close on Feb. 8, 2021, and be accretive to Utz's earnings. Utz plans to transition most of Vitner's manufacturing to its own facilities following the acquisition.

feed.title: Utz Brands Inc. announces $25 million acquisition of assets related to Vitner's snack food brand from Snak-King
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced the acquisition of assets related to the Vitner's snack food brand from Snak-King Corp. for $25 million. This strategic move aims to strengthen Utz's presence in the Chicago market, moving it from the No. 7 to the No. 4 position in salty snacks. The acquisition, expected to close on February 8, will also involve transitioning Vitner's product manufacturing to Utz's plants.

feed.title: utz brands completes acquisition of on the border ® tortilla chips
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced the completion of its subsidiaries' acquisition of Truco Enterprises, the seller of ON THE BORDER® tortilla chips, salsa, and queso, for $480 million. This acquisition positions Utz as the #3 player in the tortilla chip market and significantly expands its national footprint. To help fund the transaction, Utz will redeem outstanding public and forward purchase warrants, expected to generate approximately $181.3 million in gross proceeds.

feed.title: Utz Brands to acquire Insignia Portfolio Company Truco Enterprises
feed.summary: Insignia Capital Group announced it has entered a definitive agreement to sell Truco Enterprises, maker of On The Border tortilla chips, salsa, and queso, to Utz Brands (NYSE: UTZ) for $480 million. The deal is expected to close in December 2020. This acquisition follows Insignia and Truco's collaboration which significantly expanded the company's distribution and innovation, tripling adjusted EBITDA over six years.

feed.title: Utz Brands to acquire Truco Enterprises, the owner of 'On the Border' Tortilla Chips
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced its definitive agreement to acquire Truco Enterprises, the owner of the 'On the Border' tortilla chips, salsa, and queso brand, for $480 million. This acquisition will make Utz a significant competitor in the tortilla chip sub-category, enhance its national geographic footprint, and is expected to be accretive to earnings in 2021 and beyond. The transaction strengthens Utz's competitive position and financial profile by adding a growing Power Brand with significant scale and presence in Mass and Club retail channels.

feed.title: Utz Brands to acquire Truco Enterprises
feed.summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced its plan to acquire Truco Enterprises for $480 million. Truco Enterprises manufactures tortilla chips, salsa, and queso under the On The Border (OTB) brand, which will significantly expand Utz's presence in the salty snack category. The acquisition is expected to boost Utz Brands' total retail sales to approximately $1.3 billion.

feed.title: Utz Quality Foods and Collier Creek Holdings Complete Business Combination to Form Utz Brands, Inc.
feed.summary: Utz Quality Foods and Collier Creek Holdings have completed their business combination, forming Utz Brands, Inc. The new entity will trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "UTZ" starting August 31, 2020, following shareholder approval. This transaction marks Utz's transition to a publicly listed company after nearly 100 years as a family-owned business, aiming to fuel future growth and expansion in the salty snack industry.
